CatDescriptText: August Sommers, hotel employee, Crafton and John Morgan, postal clerk, Oakland, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, November 25, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think Negroes should hold high political offices, particularly those which have payrolls attached?" August Sommers' answer reads: "Some Negroes already hold such positions.  If the man has the ability and the talent, why shouldn't he hold such positions?  We don't practice this in our business, so why should it be practiced elsewhere?"  John Morgan's answer reads: "Sure, because we are voting for representation."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of August Sommers wearing dark fedora, diagonally striped tie, and dark overcoat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall, Downtown; Portrait of John Morgan wearing dark fedora with woven band, light colored striped shirt with opened collar, and light colored overcoat, standing in front of ribbed metal wall, Downtown
